greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=a(2)=a(3)=1; thereafter a(n) = gpf(a(n-1)+a(n-2)+a(n-3)), where gpf = "greatest prime factor".
comment: After 86 steps, enters a cycle of length 212 (see A177923).
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
G. Back and M. Caragiu, The greatest prime factor and recurrent sequences, Fib. Q., 48 (2010), 358-362.
maple: with(numtheory, divisors); A006530 := proc(n) local i, t1, t2, t3, t4, t5; t1 := divisors(n); t2 := convert(t1, list); t3 := sort(t2); t4 := nops(t3); t5 := 1; for i from 1 to t4 do if isprime(t3[t4+1-i]) then RETURN(t3[t4+1-i]); fi; od; 1; end;
for n from 4 to M do
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 16 2010
